content.text:
# Volga dwarf goby

| taxon = Hyrcanogobius bergi
| authority = Iljin, 1928
| synonyms =
* Knipowitschia bergi (Iljin, 1928)
}}
Hyrcanogobius bergi, the Volga dwarf goby, is a species of goby endemic to the Caspian Sea where it occurs in fresh, brackish and marine waters along the coast.  Unusual for gobies, this species is almost a fully pelagic fish.  H. bergi grows to a length of  SL.  This species is also the only known member of its genus. The specific name honours the Soviet zoologist Lev Berg (1876-1950) who described many new species of goby from the Caspian Sea.
